Kata Wishnutama untuk Pariwisata Papua Barat
07 Nov 2019, 22:36 by Rolando Fransiscus Sihombing


Foto: (dok Kementerian Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif)

Jakarta -
Menteri Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif (Menparekraf) Wishnutama tampaknya sudah menyimpan sejumlah gagasan, salah satunya untuk pengembangan pariwisata di wilayah Papua Barat."Papua Barat itu kan ada Raja Ampat. Sesuatu yang amat sangat menarik sekali, tapi kan akses ke sana masih belum mudah," katanya di Gedung DPR, Jakarta, Kamis (7/11/2019), menjawab pertanyaan rencana soal pariwisata Papua Barat."Nah itu saya pernah bicara juga dengan beberapa kawan-kawan di Papua Barat dan menteri lain," lanjut pria kelahiran Jayapura, Papua pada 49 tahun lalu itu.
Papua Barat secara khusus Raja Ampat, sebut Wishnutama, dikenal punya pemandangan indah tapi akses menuju ke sana masih terbilang sulit. Padahal potensi wisata di sana, seperti spot diving dan wisata alam, sangat menjanjikan."Bagaimana ini jadi daya tarik dan mudah juga ke sananya. Karena mungkin itu salah satu lokasi diving yang terbaik di dunia, bagaimana kita mempromosikan," ujarnya.
Diketahui, hingga saat ini belum ada penerbangan pesawat komersil langsung menuju ke Raja Ampat. Sejauh ini traveler harus lebih dulu terbang ke Sorong dan dilanjutkan dengan perjalanan via speedboat atau ferry selama kurang dari 2 jam agar bisa menikmati keindahan alam di sana."Tapi jangan sampai mempromosikan itu membuat wisatawan kecewa 'wah susah ke sini, sengasara' jangan begitu. Harus dibikin konektivitas. Kalau kecewa, nggak akan balik lagi karena banyak wisata di dunia. Itu yang penting," tutup Wishnutama.Wacananya, saat ini pihak Pemkab Raja Ampat telah mewacanakan hadirnya bandara di Waisai, ibukota Kabupaten Raja Ampat. Apabila sudah jadi, nantinya konektifitas menuju Raja Ampat akan semakin mudah dan cepat.

Wishnutama said for West Papua Tourism
Nov 7 2019, 22:36 by Rolando Fransiscus Sihombing


Photo: (dock of the Ministry of Tourism and Creative Economy)

Jakarta -
Minister of Tourism and Creative Economy (Menparekraf) Wishnutama seems to have saved a number of ideas, one of which is for the development of tourism in the region of West Papua. "West Papua is Raja Ampat. It is very, very interesting, but access to it is still not easy, "he said at the Parliament Building, Jakarta, Thursday (11/07/2019), answering the question of plans for West Papua tourism." Well, I have also talked with some friends in West Papua and other ministers, "continued the man born in Jayapura, Papua 49 years ago.
West Papua in particular Raja Ampat, said Wishnutama, is known to have beautiful scenery but access to it is still relatively difficult. Whereas the tourism potential there, such as diving spots and nature tourism, is very promising. "How this is also an attraction and easy to get there too. Because maybe it's one of the best diving locations in the world, how do we promote," he said.
It is known, until now there has not been a direct commercial flight to Raja Ampat. So far the traveler must first fly to Sorong and continue by traveling via speedboat or ferry for less than 2 hours to be able to enjoy the natural beauty there. "But don't promote it making tourists disappointed 'it's hard to come here, miserable' don't be like that. Connectivity must be made. If disappointed, it will not come back because there are many tours in the world. That is important, "closed Wishnutama. When it is finished, connectivity to Raja Ampat will be easier and faster.
